title: Ticket #6968: IpVerify initialization shouldn't happen in middle of new connection
description:
The Condor security authorization tables maintained by the IpVerify class are initialized lazily the first time an authorization decision needs to be made. This happens in the middle of the first network connection that the process makes (as either client or server), as its peer is waiting. The IpVerify initialization can include numerous DNS queries for hostnames mentioned in the security configuration. If any of these queries end up blocking for a long time, the peer may timeout and close the connection.

For a long-lived daemon, this is usually a minor inconvenience, as the IpVerify initialization is only done once. For the shadow, it becomes a major problem, as the shadow will exit with failure if the startd hangs up on it when trying to activate the claim. This was demonstrated this week in a thread on htcondor-users.

The IpVerify initialization should be done before any network connections are established. For daemons, this could be explicitly as part of daemoncore's startup. For tools, this could be done somewhere inside SecMan::startCommand() before the socket is created.
